snippet: American negotiators say the key is to leave Iran with a face-saving nuclear structure but one small enough to overcome congressional objections.
abstract: Negotiators for Iran and six world powers meeting in Vienna say they are finally confronting size and shape of nuclear fuel production capability that Iran will be permitted to retain, crucial sticking point to a permanent agreement.

byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and STEVEN ERLANGER
byline.contributor: David E. Sanger reported from Washington, and Steven Erlanger from Brussels.

lead_paragraph: American negotiators say the key is to leave Iran with a face-saving nuclear structure but one small enough to overcome congressional objections.

headline.main: Nuclear Talks Will Confront Iran’s Future Capability to Enrich Uranium
headline.print_headline: Nuclear Talks Will Confront Iran’s Future Capability to Enrich Uranium
